gurmukhi: ਅਥ ਨਲਨੀ ਸੁਕ ੳੁਨੀਵੋ ਗੁਰ ਕਥਨੰ ॥
transliteration: Ath Nalani Souk Ouneevo Gur Kathanan||
translation: Now begins the description of the adoption of the Parrot as the Ninteenth Guru

gurmukhi: ਮੁਨਿਅਤਿ ਅਪਾਰ ॥ ਗੁਣ ਗਣ ੳੁਦਾਰ ॥ ਬਿੱਦਿਅਾ ਬਿਚਾਰ ॥ ਨਿਤ ਕਰਤ ਚਾਰ ॥੩੮੯॥
transliteration: Mounndat(i) Apaar|| Goun Gad Udaar|| Biddiaa Bichaar|| Nit Karat Chaar||389||
translation: The sage, benevolent in qualities, was a thinker about learning and always practiced his learning.389.

gurmukhi: ਲਖਿ ਛਬਿ ਸੁਰੰਗ ॥ ਲਾਜਤ ਅਨੰਗ ॥ ਪਿਖ ਬਿਮਲ ਅੰਗ ॥ ਚਕਿ ਰਹਤ ਗੰਗ ॥੩੯੦॥
transliteration: Lakh(i) Chhab(i) Suran|| Laajat Anan|| Pikh Bimal An|| Chak(i) Rahat Gadg||390||
translation: Seeing his beauty, the god of love felt shy and seeing the purity of his limabs, the Ganges was wonder-struck.390.

gurmukhi: ਲਖਿ ਦੁਤਿ ਅਪਾਰ ॥ ਰੀਝਤ ਕੁਮਾਰ ॥ ਗਯਾਨੀ ਅਪਾਰ ॥ ਗੁਨ ਗਨ ੳੁਦਾਰ ॥੩੯੧॥
transliteration: Lakh(i) Dout(i) Apnr|| Reejhat Koumaar|| Guaaniapaar|| Goun Gadudaar||391,
translation: Seeing his comeliness all the princes felt pleased, because he was the greatest scholar and generous and accomplished person.391.

gurmukhi: ਅਬਯਕਤ ਅੰਗ ॥ ਅਾਭਾ ਅਭੰਗ ॥ ਸੋਭਾ ਸੁਰੰਗ ॥ ਤਨ ਜਨ ਅਨੰਗ ॥੩੯੨॥
transliteration: Abyakat An|| Aabhaa Abhan|| Sobhaa Suran|| Tan Jan Anan||392||
translation: The glory of his limbs was indescribable; he was pretty like the god of love.392.

gurmukhi: ਬਹੁ ਕਰਤ ਨਯਾਸ ॥ ਨਿਸਦਿਨ ੳੁਦਾਸ ॥ ਤਜਿ ਸਰਬ ਅਾਸ ॥ ਅਤਿ ਬੁੱਧਿ ਪ੍ਰਕਾਸ਼ ॥੩੯੩॥
transliteration: Bahu Karat Nyaas|| Nisdin Udaas|| Taj(i) Sarab Aas|| At(i) Buddh(i) Prakaadh||393||
translation: He performed many practices detachedly night and day and had relinquished all the desires because of the unfoldment of knowledge.393.

gurmukhi: ਤਨ ਸਹਤ ਧੂਪ ॥ ਸੰਨਯਾਸ ਭੂਪ ॥ ਤਨਿ ਛਬਿ ਅਨੂਪ ॥ ਜਨੁ ਸ਼ਿਵ ਸਰੂਪ ॥੩੯੪॥
transliteration: Tan Sahat Dhoop|| Sannyaas Bhoop|| Tan(i) Chhab(i) Anoop|| Jan(u) Shiv Daroop||394||
translation: The sage Dutt, the king of Sannyas looked very beautiful like Shiva, while enduring the sunshine on his body, allied with unique comeliness.394.

gurmukhi: ਮੁਖਿ ਛਬਿ ਪ੍ਰਚੰਡ ॥ ਅਾਡਾਂ ਅਭੰਗ ॥ ਜੁਟਿ ਜੋਗ ਜੰਗ ॥ ਨਹੀ ਮੁਰਤ ਅੰਗ ॥੩੯੫॥
transliteration: Moukh(i) Chhab(i) Prachanndd|| Aabhaa Abhan|| Jouttee Jog Jan|| Nahimurat An||395||
translation: The beauty of his limbs and face was perfect and powerful; his limbs, practising Yoga, did not bend.395.

gurmukhi: ਅਤਿ ਛਬਿ ਪ੍ਰਕਾਸ਼ ॥ ਨਿਸ ਦਿਨ ਨਿਰਾਸ ॥ ਮੁਨ ਮਨ ਸੁਬਾਸ ॥ ਗੁਨ ਗਨ ੳੁਦਾਸ ॥੩੯੬॥
transliteration: At(i) Chhab(i) Prakaadh|| Nis Din Niraas|| Mounndman Soubaas|| Goun Gad Udaas||396||
translation: Through extremely comely, he remained desireless night and day and adopting the qualities, the sage lived detachedly.396.

gurmukhi: ਅਬਯਕਤ ਜੋਗ ॥ ਨਹੀ ਕੳੁਨ ਸੋਗ ॥ ਨਿਤਪ੍ਰਤਿ ਅਰੋਗ ॥ ਤਜਿ ਰਾਜ ਭੋਗ ॥੩੯੭॥
transliteration: Abyakat Jog|| Nahikaoun Sog|| Nitprat(i)darog|| Taj(i) Raaj Bhog||397||
translation: Being absorbed in unexpressible Yoga, he was far away from all foundnesses; even on forsaking all the royal luxuries, he always remained healthy.397.

gurmukhi: ਮੁਨ ਮਨ ਕ੍ਰਿਪਾਲ ॥ ਗੁਨ ਗਨ ਦਿਅਾਲ ॥ ਸੁਭਿ ਮਤਿ ਸੁਢਾਲ ॥ ਦ੍ਰਿੜ ਬ੍ਰਿਤ ਕਰਾਲ ॥੩੯੮॥
transliteration: Mounndman Kridaal|| Goun Gad Diaal|| Soubh(i) Mat(i) Sudhaal|| Drid Brit Karaal||398||
translation: That kind sage, was allied with qualities; he was a man of good intellect, a resolute vow-observer and merciful.398.

gurmukhi: ਤਨ ਸਹਤ ਸੀਤ ॥ ਨਹੀ ਮੁਰਤ ਚੀਤ ॥ ਬਹੁ ਬਰਖ ਬੀਤ ॥ ਜਨੁ ਜੋਗ ਜੀਤ ॥੩੯੯॥
transliteration: Tan Sohat Seet|| Nahimurat Cheet|| Bahu Barakh Beet|| Jan(u) Jog Jeet||399||
translation: Enduring coldness on his body, his mind never got impaired and in this way after many years, he had been victorious in Yogs.399.

gurmukhi: ਚਾਲੰਤ ਬਾਤ ॥ ਥਰਕੰਤ ਪਾਤ ॥ ਪੀਅ ਅਾਤ ਗਾਤ ॥ ਨਹੀ ਬਦਤ ਬਾਤ ॥੪੦੦॥
transliteration: Dhaalant Baat|| Tharkant Paat|| Peea Aat Gadt|| Nahibadat Baat||400||
translation: When that Yogi talked, the leaves of the trees swerved; and knowing the attributes of the Lord, he did not disclose anything to others.400.
